The digital footprint created enhances financial literacy and formalizes the informal sector.

Total expenses for the year climbed 22.6% to Rs 2,881 crore, compared with Rs 2,350 crore in the previous fiscal. Employee benefit expenses jumped 36.3% to Rs 649 crore from Rs 476 crore.

articles.title: Google India net inches up in FY25
articles.summary: Net profit rose 0.8% to Rs 1,437 crore in FY25 from Rs 1,425 crore in the previous fiscal. Revenue from operations declined 3.2% to Rs 5,340 crore compared with Rs 5,518 crore a year earlier. Total income, however, increased 3.3% to Rs 6,116 crore from Rs 5,921 crore.

articles.title: Ex-Google engineer convicted of stealing AI secrets for Chinese companies
articles.summary: Linwei Ding, a 38-year-old Chinese ‌national, was ‌found guilty after an 11-day trial of seven counts of economic espionage and seven counts ‌of theft of trade secrets for stealing thousands of pages of confidential information.

articles.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX in merger talks with xAI ahead of planned IPO, source says
articles.summary: Musk, the world's richest man, is the CEO of both the private space company SpaceX and the artificial intelligence company xAI, which controls his social ‌media platform X. He also runs ‌electric automaker Tesla, tunnel company The Boring Co. and neurotechnology company Neuralink.

articles.title: Apple warns memory costs are starting to bite as Samsung, SK Hynix prioritise AI chips
articles.summary: Apple will likely need more and ‌more memory chips as demand for its latest iPhone 17 has surged, especially in China and India. Cook called demand for the device in the December quarter "staggering," but declined to answer a question from an analyst on whether Apple might raise product pricing because of the paucity of memory chips.

articles.title: Quick commerce march trampling on ecommerce toes
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce grocery delivery is rapidly eating into ecommerce sales, which are being disrupted more than kirana stores. Quick commerce now accounts for nearly half of online grocery sales and is set to dominate two-thirds by 2030. Ecommerce firms are adapting, with many shifting towards quick commerce models.

articles.title: Rising digital addiction prompts call for age-based online access
articles.summary: Screen impact addictive use of smartphones, gaming and social media linked to lost study hours, lower productivity, sleep disruption and rising stress across age groups.

articles.title: Is chip giant ASML about to hit a ceiling, or break through it?
articles.summary: ASML shares are up 34% so ‌far this month and ‌trade at 42 times 2026 earnings estimates, well above Nvidia's 25 times, as analysts have ratcheted up forecasts. ASML management sees sales growth this year ranging from as low ‌as 4% to as high as 19%.

articles.title: Banned to back again: A timeline of TikTok's rise, fall and rebirth
articles.summary: TikTok evolved from a teen dance app into a dominant US platform shaping culture, commerce and politics.

articles.title: With 'mother of all deals' in bag, Piyush Goyal says mother will be compassionate, fair to all 28 children
articles.summary: India's trade pact with the European Union is set to significantly boost exports. The agreement, expected this year, will grant 99 percent of Indian goods duty-free access to Europe. This move is projected to double India's exports to the EU within five years. Businesses are encouraged to expand and capitalize on this opportunity.

articles.title: India's Oct-Jan sugar output up 18.35 pc to 19.50 mn tonne : ISMA
articles.summary: India's sugar production has seen a significant jump of 18.35 percent. As of January 31 of the 2025-26 season, output reached 19.50 million tonnes. This increase is driven by higher production in key states like Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, and Karnataka. More sugar mills are operational this season. ISMA projects a substantial overall rise in sugar production for the entire season.

articles.title: Political polarisation hurting transparency; India 'mystery' for global investors: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee
articles.summary: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee warns that India's political polarization is eroding transparency, making the country a "mystery" to global investors despite robust growth. He emphasizes that media freedom and credible data are crucial for attracting stable foreign investment, cautioning against policy unpredictability and internal divisions.

articles.title: Precious metals melt as $ flexes, world markets action heats up
articles.summary: Friday witnessed a steep drop in the prices of gold and silver, primarily spurred by the strengthening US dollar and a liquidation of yen carry trades. This sharp decrease affected both spot pricing and exchange-traded funds in the precious metals sphere, prompting many investors to cash in on profits after a bullish January.

articles.title: Inflation basket rejig: AirPods gain weight, food portion cut
articles.summary: India's inflation measurement is getting a significant upgrade. New items like AirPods and hand sanitisers are joining the Consumer Price Index. The base year is shifting to 2024 from 2012. This overhaul aims to provide a more accurate picture of price changes. The changes will help the Reserve Bank of India make better monetary policy decisions.

articles.title: Strong domestic private sector investment key to attract net FDI inflows to India: Raghuram Rajan
articles.summary: Raghuram Rajan: When asked whether he thinks it is very odd for capital to be fleeing from a country where economic growth at 7.4 per cent (FY26) is much greater than anywhere in the world, he said: "Well, FDI would come in if your private sector were also investing, but your private sector is not investing."

articles.title: Gold, silver reel from worst-ever rout ahead of Budget: What lies ahead for prices?
articles.summary: Gold and silver are stabilising after their worst-ever single-day crash on MCX, with traders bracing for fresh volatility as the Union Budget approaches. Analysts say the correction reflects a leverage washout, not a trend reversal, with key support zones likely to guide the next leg of the precious metals rally.

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Sunday
articles.summary: Markets slipped on Friday as investors turned defensive ahead of Sunday’s Union Budget, with IT and metal stocks weighing on sentiment. Analysts highlighted persistent volatility amid global uncertainties, Fed leadership changes and FII pressure. With key levels holding firm, traders now await Budget cues to determine the market’s next decisive move.

articles.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy CCL Products, Aurobindo Pharma on Feb 1 for up to 8% upside. Here’s why
articles.summary: Indian markets experienced a downturn on Friday, with Nifty ending its winning streak due to selling in key sectors. Geopolitical worries, the upcoming Union Budget, and a weakening rupee contributed to subdued sentiment. Analysts anticipate volatility during Sunday's special trading session, advising a cautious, hedged approach ahead of the budget announcement.

articles.title: Dalal Street Week Ahead: All eyes on Budget 2026 as Nifty sets up near key levels
articles.summary: Nifty ended the week with modest gains as markets stayed range-bound ahead of the Union Budget. The index defended key moving averages and hovered near a crucial trendline. With resistance at 25,500 and support at 24,750–24,900, traders should stay cautious and focus on stock-specific setups until post-Budget clarity emerges.

articles.title: Is ‘AI-washing’ behind new wave of tech layoffs?
articles.summary: Companies are increasingly pointing to artificial intelligence when announcing job cuts, alongside more traditional reasons such as weak finances or overhiring. AI was mentioned in over 50,000 layoffs in 2025, with firms like Amazon, Pinterest and HP linking cuts to future AI-driven changes. Critics warn some companies may be using “AI-washing” to justify cost-driven layoffs.

articles.title: Videogame stocks slide on Google's AI model that turns prompts into playable worlds
articles.summary: Shares of videogame companies fell sharply on Friday after Google launched its AI model, Project Genie, which can create interactive digital worlds from text or images. Take-Two, Roblox, and Unity dropped 9–19% as the technology could disrupt traditional game development. Developers fear faster cycles may cut costs but threaten jobs.

articles.title: JJG Aero raises $30 million from Norwest to scale capacity
articles.summary: Aerospace components maker JJG Aero has raised $30 million in funding led by Norwest, marking the investor’s first bet in the segment in India. The company plans to expand manufacturing capacity as global aircraft demand remains strong. Industry leaders say India offers major growth potential in aerospace manufacturing.

articles.title: Reliance leads $50 million round in spacetech startup Digantara at $200 million valuation
articles.summary: Reliance Industries has led a $50 million funding round in spacetech startup Digantara, valuing the firm at about $200 million. The Bengaluru-based company tracks satellites and space debris using its own space-based technology and plans global expansion. The funding will support overseas growth, satellite manufacturing and higher production capacity.

articles.title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $777 million in January so far; down 14% on-year
articles.summary: Startups across multiple stages raised the funds through 112 deals, compared to 210 in the year-ago period.

articles.title: India to expand AI training to 500 universities under AI Mission 2.0
articles.summary: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology announced a new plan to expand artificial intelligence training to 500 universities across the country. This initiative aims to create a talent pipeline for the industry by providing specialised course curriculum and training opportunities for students. The program follows a model used in the semiconductor sector, where students at 315 universities are already designing chips.

articles.title: Indian IT industry shifting from software to AI-driven solution: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: Cervical cancer awareness: Why timely screening is key for prevention
articles.summary: Cervical Cancer Awareness Month brings visibility, but visibility alone is not enough. Awareness must lead to decisions. Screening should not be framed as a burden or an obligation, but as a practical step toward long-term well-being, notes NURA AI Health's Dr Bilal Thangal T M.

articles.title: Changes to India's inflation weights explained in three simple points
articles.summary: India’s new CPI series represents a significant structural recalibration in the India's inflation measurement framework, writes Dr. Arun Singh, Global Chief Economist, Dun & Bradstreet.

articles.title: Kolkata fire: Adhikari leads rally, demands arrest of food chain owners
articles.summary: Adhikari alleged that the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) was shielding those responsible for the tragedy and showing insensitivity, claiming that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had not visited the site even five days after the incident, while rescue and search operations were still underway.

articles.title: Meet Kevin Warsh — The 17th Federal Reserve Chair picked by Donald Trump
articles.summary: Warsh's vast career spans across the private sector and Capitol Hill, as well as senior roles within the Federal Reserve. He studied public policy at Stanford University, with an emphasis on economics and statistics.

articles.title: New Fed leadership and policy uncertainty to keep markets volatile: Ned Davis strategist
articles.summary: Ed Clissold of Ned Davis Research expects growth to slow later in the year and warns that earnings expectations may be revised lower, increasing the risk of a market pullback.

articles.title: Services exports hit 10% of GDP, reinforce India’s external resilience: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2026 highlights services exports as a key growth driver for India, with software and consulting leading, rising to 10% of GDP and boosted by global demand and trade agreements.

articles.title: India’s 7% growth outlook supports markets, but economists flag fiscal, trade, and currency risks
articles.summary: India’s near-7% growth outlook supports market sentiment, but economists caution that underlying sectoral fragilities, delayed trade risks and inflation-linked fiscal assumptions will remain key watchpoints for equities, bonds and the rupee.

articles.title: Indian economy shows steady momentum in December, says new monthly economy index by Moneycontrol
articles.summary: Moneycontrol’s Eco Pulse is a composite high-frequency index which aims to measure India’s economic momentum on a monthly basis and provide early signals of changes in the direction of GDP growth.

articles.title: Late to AI, but better placed: Economic Survey says India can skip the costly AI arms race
articles.summary: Its comparative advantage in the AI era, the Survey says, does not lie in building frontier-scale models. Instead, it lies in application-led innovation, the productive use of domestic data, the depth of human capital, and the ability of public institutions to coordinate distributed efforts across sectors.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 | FPIs dump equities, rotate into debt amid global risk-off
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2026 | Foreign portfolio investors turned net sellers of Indian equities in Q2 and Q3 FY26, even as debt inflows rose, amid global uncertainty, rupee weakness and elevated US bond yields.

articles.title: India remains fastest-growing major economy for the fourth consecutive year, says Economic Survey
articles.summary: The Survey states that the Gross Value Added (GVA) growth rate for FY26 is placed at 7.3%, reflecting strong growth momentum despite global economic uncertainty. The estimates were released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) on Thursday, January 29.

articles.title: CEA suggests minimum wage per hour or task for India's gig workers
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2024-25 projects non-agricultural gigs to reach 6.7 percent of workforce and contribute ₹2.35 lakh crore to GDP by 2029-30, driven by smartphone and UPI growth.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 warns of uncertainties as India attempts to solve AI-labour puzzle
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 urges caution on AI in India, citing Yale’s study and uncertainties, despite reassuring short-term evidence for labour-rich economies.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 pegs India’s FY27 growth at 6.8-7.2%, outlook remains positive
articles.summary: India’s economy is projected to grow 6.8–7.2% in FY27, with domestic demand continuing to anchor activity, the Economic Survey said. It cautioned that global risks remain elevated amid a fragile external environment.

articles.title: India Defence Budget 2026: What to expect
articles.summary: India’s Defence Budget 2026 may see cautious growth amid geopolitical tensions, indigenisation push, and rising demand for modernisation.

articles.title: India government sets deadline for financial bids for IDBI, says report
articles.summary: India sets February 5 deadline for financial bids in IDBI Bank divestment, with Fairfax Financial Holdings, Emirates NBD and Kotak Mahindra Bank approved as bidders for a 60.7% stake sale.

articles.title: Relaxo Footwears Q3 FY26 profit falls 20% to ₹26.5 crore despite stable revenue
articles.summary: Relaxo Footwears posted steady topline performance in the December quarter, supported by strong traction in organised retail, e-commerce, and large-format stores. However, higher expenses weighed on profitability, prompting the company to emphasise a balanced focus on growth and margins going forward.

articles.title: Ashoka Buildcon's net profit jumps over three-fold; revenue falls 23%
articles.summary: Ashoka Buildcon's Q3 profit jumped to ₹2,111.41 crore, despite a 23% revenue drop. Shares of Ashoka Buildcon Ltd ended higher on Friday, January 30, by 3.72% at ₹149.99 on the NSE.

articles.title: Air India AI171 crash probe: AAIB examining aircraft components, ‘nothing ruled out’ yet
articles.summary: Investigators probing the deadly June 2025 Air India Dreamliner crash are continuing a multi-layered assessment of technical systems, cockpit actions, organisational processes and environmental conditions. Sources say the AAIB is closely examining specific aircraft components while following an elimination-based framework, even as speculation over possible pilot-related factors draws scrutiny.

articles.title: Top stories | Trump’s Fed pick, gold and silver in tailspin, SEBI nod for NSE IPO & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Real estate mogul C J Roy found dead in Bengaluru office; suicide suspected
articles.summary: CJ Roy, Founder of Confident Group, was found dead at his Bengaluru office after a gunshot was heard, amid Income Tax Department searches and questioning. Police suspect suicide.

articles.title: Ravi Kota chosen as next HAL CMD; to take charge in May 2026
articles.summary: Ravi Kota, known as the LCA man, is set to become HAL Chairman in May 2026, leading key Tejas fighter jet milestones and driving India's defence manufacturing self-reliance.

articles.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX to consider merger with Tesla: claim reports
articles.summary: SpaceX is exploring a merger with Tesla or xAI, aiming to unite rockets, Starlink, X, and Grok AI before a major IPO, Bloomberg and Reuters report. Tesla shares rose 3 percent after the news.

articles.title: Top Stories | Economic Survey signals India’s stability, Nifty reclaims 25,400, Dabur, ITC results and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 - CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights - delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Buy gold and sell silver as the metals' run to record unwinds, says Carter Worth
articles.summary: Carter Worth looks at the silver/gold ratio.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar funeral in Baramati: Sons perform last rites; Amit Shah, Fadnavis attend
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, 66, died on the morning of Wednesday, January 28, when a chartered Learjet carrying him crashed near the Baramati airstrip. Politicians across parties and states have reached Baramati to attend Ajit Pawar's last rites.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: Ram temple construction expected to end by April 30; overall estimated cost ₹1,900 cr
articles.summary: Ram temple construction in Ayodhya will finish by April 30 at a cost of ₹1,900 crore, says Nripendra Mishra. L T and Tata Consultancy will exit after completion, with a three-year warranty.

articles.title: Children among six injured as suspicious material explodes in Karnataka's Bidar
articles.summary: Bidar, Karnataka: Six injured, including four children, after suspicious material exploded near Molige Marayya temple in Molkhera. Investigation underway.

articles.title: Cooch Behar bridge collapses as truck crosses, no casualties reported
articles.summary: According to locals, the bridge collapsed due to the dumper's high weight. The event caused traffic in the region to halt.

articles.title: Weather Update: Rain likely in Delhi over weekend, Rajasthan set for hailstorms
articles.summary: IMD issued a yellow alert for the national capital during the weekend, warning of light rain, thunderstorms and potential dense fog.

articles.title: Telecom services suspended in parts of J&K's Kishtwar amid anti-terror operation
articles.summary: The Jammu and Kashmir government has suspended 2G to 5G mobile data in parts of Kishtwar from January 29 to 30, citing security concerns as forces continue anti-terror operations in the district.

articles.title: Watch: IAF Mi-17V5 helicopters drop 12,000 litres on high-altitude Lohit Valley wildfire
articles.summary: The Indian Air Force deployed Mi-17V5 helicopters to drop 12,000 litres of water on a major wildfire in Arunachal Pradesh’s Lohit Valley, battling flames in rarefied high-altitude terrain.

articles.title: Watch: Two paragliders crash into Tehri lake; SDRF rescues pilots
articles.summary: The two pilots lost control mid-air during an acrobatic manoeuvre, leading them to plunge into the lake.

articles.title: Delhi SWAT commando death: Husband told brother ‘I am killing your sister’ on call; all to know
articles.summary: A Delhi Police SWAT commando, four months pregnant, died after an alleged assault by her husband in West Delhi. A call recording, dowry harassment claims and a murder investigation have emerged.

articles.title: Wildfire tears through Nagaland’s Dzukou valley for 3rd day, reaches Manipur’s highest peak Mount Esii
articles.summary: The Dzukou Valley is a well-known and picturesque location with seasonal wildflowers, rolling green hills, and the rare Dzukou lily. It is extremely combustible due to the dry winter weather, particularly the dry grass and bamboo that cover a large portion of the terrain.

articles.title: Martyrs’ Day in India: Key dates, history and why it is observed
articles.summary: India observes Martyrs’ Day on 30 January and 23 March to honour Gandhi and revolutionary heroes, with a nationwide two-minute silence and quiet events in schools and public offices.

articles.title: Kolkata Anandpur fire: Wow! Momos' Manager and Deputy Manager arrested, toll rises to 25
articles.summary: The West Bengal government has announced a compensation amount of ₹10 lakh to the families of the deceased in the accident.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Aviation Minister seeks Fadnavis support for speedy probe; what we know so far
articles.summary: Prove reveals that Baramati is an ‘uncontrolled airfield’ without an instrument landing system, with traffic advisories typically provided by flying training instructors.

articles.title: Delhi traffic advisory for Jan 30: Avoid these routes for Martyr's Day event
articles.summary: Delhi Police will enforce traffic diversions near Rajghat on January 30 for the Martyr’s Day event attended by dignitaries. Key junctions and roads will face restrictions from 9 am to 12 noon.

articles.title: Rain and snowfall to batter Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal; light showers likely in Delhi-NCR
articles.summary: Rain and snowfall with thunderstorms and strong winds are expected over Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit, Baltistan, and Muzaffarabad from January 30 to February 1.

articles.title: Merger of two NCPs was in offing, Ajit Pawar was keen on it
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar was set to merge both NCP factions soon, with Sharad Pawar and Supriya Sule in positive talks. His sudden death makes unity crucial for Baramati and Maharashtra.

articles.title: FM broadcasters, device manufacturers call for ₹2,500 crore FM radio market to go digital
articles.summary: BES Expo at Bharat Mandapam saw Red FM, ICEA, and Xperi advocate India's shift to HD Radio, aiming for cost-effective digital FM adoption and policy support for millions of listeners.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026 gets global response, over 200 AI models to be launched: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: India AI Impact Summit 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, will host 500 events, 840 exhibitors, and global leaders, with $70 billion AI investments and major industry partners like OpenAI and Google.

articles.title: SpaceX sends 54 Starlink satellites in two days, total in orbit passes 9,600
articles.summary: SpaceX launched 54 Starlink satellites across two Falcon 9 missions from Florida and California, expanding its global satellite internet network and pushing its total satellites in orbit past 9,600.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX launches Stargaze for safer satellite operations
articles.summary: By providing free ephemeris sharing and conjunction screening, SpaceX aims to encourage satellite operators to adopt more transparent and safer orbital practices.

articles.title: Apple acquires Israeli audio AI startup Q.ai
articles.summary: Apple did not say how it will use Q.ai's technology but said the startup has worked on new applications of machine learning to help devices understand whispered speech and to enhance audio in challenging environments.

articles.title: Economic Survey warns GPU shortages could delay India’s data centre and AI expansion plans
articles.summary: The Economic Survey highlights rising compute costs and GPU shortages as AI bottlenecks in India, but sees late-mover advantage in application-led innovation and resource-efficient AI systems.

articles.title: AI-generated ads as effective as human-made ones, shows global reseach
articles.summary: Taboola study with Columbia, Harvard, TUM, and Carnegie Mellon finds AI-generated ads match human ads in engagement, with higher click-through rates.

articles.title: Economic Survey flags digital addiction risks, pushes for age curbs on social media platforms
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2025–26 urges age-based access limits on digital platforms, citing risks of digital addiction among India’s youth and recommending stricter safeguards and parental involvement.

articles.title: Tesla to invest $20 billion in AI, Robotaxis, and humanoid robots
articles.summary: The company plans to scale overall vehicle output, upgrade factories, expand AI infrastructure, and accelerate production of both Optimus robots and self-driving Robotaxi vehicles.

articles.title: Google disrupts large residential proxy network, reducing devices used by operators by 'millions'
articles.summary: Residential proxy networks allow attackers to route internet traffic through hijacked consumer IP addresses, effectively masking malicious activity and bypassing security defences.

articles.title: Tesla invests $2 billion in Musk's xAI and reiterates Cybercab production starts this year
articles.summary: On Wednesday, Musk told analysts on a conference call that Tesla would stop selling its Model S sedans and Model X SUVs - flagship vehicles that once established the company as a leader in the EV market but have since dwindled to account for a small fraction of revenue. The factory space will be used to build robots.

articles.title: From Amazon to The Washington Post, Bezos' cost-cutting playbook tightens
articles.summary: Fears of layoffs at Amazon have reached Jeff Bezos-owned newspaper The Washington Post where journalists fear that a similar drive to trim costs could hollow out one of the paper’s core strengths.

articles.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of workforce in global restructuring push toward AI
articles.summary: The cuts are part of a broader transformation effort focused on reallocating resources toward AI-driven roles, prioritising AI-powered products and capabilities, and reshaping its go-to-market strategy.

articles.title: Amazon email slip reveals planned AWS layoffs
articles.summary: The content of the email reportedly also indicated that those that will be affected by layoffs were notified.

articles.title: Lawsuit alleges Meta can read WhatsApp chats; company calls it frivolous
articles.summary: According to Bloomberg, the lawsuit argues Meta’s privacy claims are false, alleging WhatsApp can “store, analyze, and access virtually all of WhatsApp users’ purportedly ‘private’ communications.”

articles.title: AI buildout to drive memory chip shortages through 2027: Synopsys CEO
articles.summary: Most memory chips available in the market today are directed towards building AI infrastructure, leaving other market segments such as consumer electronics, starved. Prices of smartphones and personal computers are expected to see sharp increase.

articles.title: Why China’s viral ‘Are You Dead Yet?’ app is striking a chord with Gen Z
articles.summary: China’s viral ‘Are You Dead Yet?’ app is gaining traction among Gen Z living alone. Here’s how it works and why young users relate to it.

articles.title: Gold rates fall from all-time highs: Why prices dropped today
articles.summary: Gold fell below ₹5,000 per ounce as investors eyed a hawkish Federal Reserve chair, but remains set for its strongest monthly gain since 1999 amid global uncertainty and safe-haven demand.

articles.title: Silver price crash: Rates on MCX in 15% lower circuit as commodities sell-off globally
articles.summary: Why silver is falling today: Analysts attributed the decline to profit-booking following recent all-time highs and a rebound in the US dollar.

articles.title: Gold, silver slide sharply in India after record rally; MCX prices fall up to 5%
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India fell sharply from record highs as profit-taking and a stronger US dollar hit MCX and spot rates, but monthly gains remain strong amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: MCX hikes gold, gold mini options strike intervals from ₹100 to ₹500
articles.summary: MCX revises Gold and Gold Mini options strike price intervals from ₹100 to ₹500 effective January 30.

articles.title: Gold, silver extend losses after brief rebound
articles.summary: Gold and silver dipped amid a stronger US dollar but are set for record monthly gains. UBS forecasts gold at $6,200 by 2026. India saw record prices despite softer physical demand.

articles.title: India silver prices cross ₹4 lakh per kg for the first time
articles.summary: Silver futures on MCX hit a record ₹4.07 lakh per kg, outpacing gold amid strong industrial demand and global supply tightness. Gold also surged, driven by inflation and geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices in India hit all-time highs on strong global cues
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India hit all-time highs on MCX, driven by global gains, US policy uncertainty, a weaker dollar, and strong safe-haven and industrial demand, say analysts.

articles.title: Silver stays near all-time high level: Factors behind metal’s sharp surge
articles.summary: Silver jumped nearly 60% this year to a record $117.69 an ounce, driven by investor demand and the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, experts say.

articles.title: UP SIR: बुजुर्गों के बाद 31-35 आयु वर्ग का सबसे बड़ा 'डिलीशन', विस्थापन बड़ी वजह
Delhivery chairman Deepak Kapoor, Director Saugata Gupta to exit board in April
articles.summary: Delhivery will see its Chairman and an independent director exit in April, continuing a board refresh that brought in four new directors last year, including executives from Emcure Pharmaceuticals, boAt Lifestyle, and PB Fintech.

articles.title: IIT Madras hosts conference on urban climate resilience; launches India Sustainability Report
articles.summary: Over 90 international researchers and policymakers gathered at IIT Madras for the Cities of Care Conference. The Sustainable India 2025 report documenting climate action across the country was also launched.

articles.title: [Weekly funding roundup Jan 24-30] Venture capital inflow sees sharp dip
articles.summary: The month of January ended on a disappointing note as the last week saw a sharp decline in venture capital funding, primarily due to a lower number of deals.

articles.title: How a global 3D startup took shape far from India’s usual tech hubs
articles.summary: From a personal tragedy to global recognition, Harsha Pedeka’s 3D startup shows how innovation can emerge from Assam. Backed by state support and driven by emotion, his journey reflects the Northeast’s growing place in India’s startup story.

articles.title: Fixing nutraceutical industry with AI; JJG Aero raises $30M in Series B
articles.summary: The Nutrify team built an AI platform atop a comprehensive, audited data stack tailored for the nutraceutical industry. This platform combines ingredients, clinical science, IP opportunities, manufacturing capabilities, and regulatory knowledge into one trusted ecosystem.

articles.title: Can't afford a full-time CTO? This startup offers tech leadership on subscription
articles.summary: Bengaluru startup Profound IQ solves the technical leadership gap for early-stage startups through fractional CTO services.

articles.title: A decade of creativity: how Museum of Goa showcases art across generations
articles.summary: In this photo essay, we showcase a range of artworks from the Museum of Goa, which celebrates over 10 years of delighting audiences with its exhibitions

articles.title: Aerospace manufacturer JJG Aero raises $30M in Series B round from Norwest
articles.summary: JJG Aero, which serves marquee clients including Collins Aerospace, Safran, and GE Aerospace, has grown at a 35% CAGR over the past three years and plans to use the funds for capacity addition and vertical integration.

articles.title: Meesho’s losses surge amid topline growth; Overseas investment made simple
articles.summary: Meesho’s quarterly report showed revenue expansion alongside a sharp spike in losses. Paasa removes paperwork and tax friction to give Indian investors access to global investments. Dastkari Haat Samiti has shaped how handicrafts are seen, sold and valued in urban India.

articles.title: How Nutrify Today is using AI in nutraceuticals to build transparent supply chains
articles.summary: The Bengaluru-based deeptech startup has built an AI platform that helps branded formulation companies move from idea to commercialisation in record time.

articles.title: Ola Electric to lay off 5% of its workforce
articles.summary: The Bhavish Aggarwal-led company added that the layoffs were part of the company’s efforts to increase automation across front end operations.

articles.title: 16 top YouTube channels uploading AI content deleted, report finds
articles.summary: YouTube is actively purging popular AI-generated channels, removing 16 of the top 100 for low-quality, repetitive content. This move, targeting channels with millions of subscribers and billions of views, aims to curb automated spam, protect genuine creators, and elevate the platform's overall content quality. YouTube is leveraging existing anti-spam tools to ensure a fairer environment for original creators.

articles.title: What happened to the ‘ghost boy’ who spent more than a decade locked inside his own body
articles.summary: South African man Martin Pistorius spent more than a decade fully conscious but unable to move or speak after a childhood illness left him misdiagnosed as vegetative. Trapped inside his body, he eventually regained communication through assistive technology. Now a father, professional and disability advocate, his story challenges assumptions about awareness, dignity and life with severe disability.
